intro: Vaccinium leptomorphum, commonly known as the slender leatherleaf, is a low-growing evergreen shrub native to the Pacific Northwest of North America. It belongs to the Ericaceae family, which includes blueberries and heathers, and is characterized by its small, leathery leaves and bell-shaped flowers. The plant typically thrives in acidic, well-drained soils and prefers cool, moist environments. Its berries, although not widely cultivated, are edible and have a tart flavor, often used in local foraging traditions. Vaccinium leptomorphum plays an important role in its ecosystem by providing habitat and food for various wildlife species.
